Congratulations Ken.

--- Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...> wrote:
> As some of you know, I am currently a post-doc but I
> have been 
> searching for a permanent position for quite some
> time now.  I have 
> finally accepted a tenure-track faculty position at
> the University 
> of Central Florida in Orlando in the Dept. of
> Computer Science: 
> www.cs.ucf.edu
> I am set to start in the Spring 2006 term, which
> begins in January.
> This will be a research-intensive position and I do
> plan on starting
> a research group there.  Annie Wu, a former student
> of John Holland, 
> is also a prof there, so there will be two people
> there now in 
> evolutionary computation.  There is also one of the
> biggest
> simulation and training labs in the country (meaning
> opportunities 
> for applications).  
> 
> Obviously I only just accepted this job so I can't
> tell people a lot 
> of details about getting into the program, etc., but
> a lot of people 
> have noted that in America there are almost no
> places to go to study 
> neuroevolution aside from UT Austin.  Therefore, I
> am hoping this 
> will be a good development for the future of our
> field and give 
> people another choice for studying and pursuing
> funded research in 
> neuroevolution and artificial embryogeny.  
> 
> ken
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
